result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian R. Parks

records.addlTxt: DEOJ Agreement
Approving DEOJ
Re: Order Approving DEOJ

Case Called:  10:49 a.m. 
Clerk:  Amy. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall for ADA Natalie Zibolski; Deft appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus in person.

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW. 
Parties have come to an agreement.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

State moves to DRI Count 2 (Battery/Domestic Abuse) and Count 3 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse); COURT grants. 

PLEA>>
Count 1 (False Imprisonment/Domestic Abuse): NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt on Count 1. COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers Count 1 for a period of 1 year for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND to Misd. Disorderly Conduct under 947.01(1). 

DEOJ RH>> 6/06/23 at 9:00am

Bond continues.

Adj:  11:00 a.m.
ATTIC: Domestic Violence VIP Program: Acceptance & Recommendation
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 9, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.

Plea: NOT GUILTY.

Review hearing on February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on February 28, 2022 at 09:20 am.

No contact with victim(s): K.K.W. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
